description:
After ex-dancer Rin trades her stage career for college life, she forms an unusual connection with a robotic RideBack motorcycle—Fuego. As a tyrannical new government oppresses the population and crushes civil liberties, Rin may have no choice but to gun Fuego’s engines and speed directly into the heart of the fight for freedom.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/younhaholic) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/younha_holic/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/younhaofficial) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialyounha/) | [Facebook (Japanese)](https://www.facebook.com/younha.jp)__

A K-Pop and J-Pop South Korean singer.

Nicknamed the "Oricon comet" for her success in Japan, she has released eight singles and two albums there with varying degrees of success. Several of her songs have been featured in anime and drama series.

Younha was signed to Epic Records, a branch of Sony Music Entertainment Japan, from 2004 to 2008, after which she moved to Sistus Records, a Geneon Entertainment label. In South Korea, she is signed to Lion Media and Stam Entertainment.
Senior vocalist for the music group I'VE SOUND.

__Kazuya Takase__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and founder of the sound unit I've Sound, which features the so-called "Love Planet Five", which is composed of 5 prolific singers in the Trance/J-pop industry (KOTOKO, Kaori Utatsuki, Eiko Shimamiya, MELL, and Mami Kawada).  Takase acts as a composer and arranger for the themes and OSTs of various anime and eroge games.

__Kazuya Takase__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and founder of the sound unit I've Sound, which features the so-called "Love Planet Five", which is composed of 5 prolific singers in the Trance/J-pop industry (KOTOKO, Kaori Utatsuki, Eiko Shimamiya, MELL, and Mami Kawada).  Takase acts as a composer and arranger for the themes and OSTs of various anime and eroge games.

Hosts "That Anime Show" with J. Michael Tatum

Husband, Stephen Hoff, also works for FUNimation Entertainment
Takafumi Wada is a Japanese Composer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/girodetakahashi)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Animates on rare occasions.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/girodetakahashi)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Animates on rare occasions.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/girodetakahashi)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Animates on rare occasions.

[Blog](http://hiroshisaito.net/blog/)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/190604/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/romanovh) | [Hatena Blog](https://romanovhiga.hateblo.jp/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/418723) | [note](https://note.com/romanovh/)

Romanov Higa, born Kazuhiro Higa, is one of the leading 3DCG animation artists in Japan. He graduated The University of Electro-Communications in Tokyo, Japan in 1996.

In 1997, his work "ONE DAY, SOME GIRL" won the Grand Prix at the 9th Amateur CG Animation Contest organized by Project Team DoGA. In 1999, he joined video game publisher Namco, but left only a few years later in 2001. He then started working freelance, mostly working on his own original movies. In recent years, his work has mostly been either storyboarding or within the art department of video games, and have notably been working on several titles in the *Pokémon* franchise.

**Non-Anime work:**
~!**Gungrave** (VG: PS2) - Movie Direction, Storyboard, Production (OP, ED, some interludes)
**Galaxy Angel** (VG: Windows, PS2, Xbox) - Movie Production (Beginning scene)
**Gungrave OD** (VG: PS2) - Movie Direction, Storyboard, Production (OP, ED, interludes)
**Princess Holiday ~Korogaru Ringotei Sen'ya Ichiya~** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Tsuki wa Higashi ni Hi wa Nishi ni ~Operation Sanctuary~** (VG: Dreamcast, PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**BALDR FORCE EXE** (VG: Dreamcast) - Direction, Storyboard, Production (Intermission movies)
**BALDR FORCE EXE** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Tenkabito** (VG: PS2) - Storyboard (Interlude movie)
**BALDR BULLET EQUILIBRIUM** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Pokémon Sun & Moon** (VG: 3DS) - Storyboard Design
**Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon** (VG: 3DS) - Storyboard Design, Scenario Movie Graphics
**Pokémon Let's Go, Pikachu! & Let's Go, Eevee!** (VG: Switch) - Storyboard Design, Scenario Movie Graphic Design
**Pokémon Sword & Shield** (VG: Switch) - Movie Graphic Design
**New Pokémon Snap** (VG: Switch) - Movie Direction
**Pokémon Legends: Arceus** (VG: Switch) - Cinematic Design Team!~

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/younhaholic) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/younha_holic/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/younhaofficial) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialyounha/) | [Facebook (Japanese)](https://www.facebook.com/younha.jp)__

A K-Pop and J-Pop South Korean singer.

Nicknamed the "Oricon comet" for her success in Japan, she has released eight singles and two albums there with varying degrees of success. Several of her songs have been featured in anime and drama series.

Younha was signed to Epic Records, a branch of Sony Music Entertainment Japan, from 2004 to 2008, after which she moved to Sistus Records, a Geneon Entertainment label. In South Korea, she is signed to Lion Media and Stam Entertainment.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高屋敷英夫)

Formerly married to fellow scriptwriter [Tomoko Konparu](https://anilist.co/staff/103462).
